title: How to Make a Baby Shower Towel Cake

steps.headline: Pick out the thing you wish to work with.
steps.description: Infant clothes, diapers, or anything like that works. Blankets and towels may be too big for cupcakes. Get some cupcake wrappers (get them themed, dinosaurs, butterflies, etc.) Also, pick out a thin ribbon to tie it together when finished. Get a tiny sock (only one). This works better when making an even number of cupcakes. You can also get a clear box, like a donut box, to put all of the cupcakes in when finished.This article is going to be referring to a baby onesie .

steps.headline: Get your onesie and fold it like you would fold paper (folding hot-dog wise).
steps.description: Do this until the onesie is thin.

steps.headline: Fold the baby sock in half and place it at the very end of the onesie strip.
Start loosely rolling the strip, starting at the end where the sock is.
steps.description: Make sure the sock stays visible. Once you're done rolling, it should start to look like a cupcake! Tape the loose end to the cupcake to prevent it from coming off.

steps.headline: Gently sit the cupcake in the wrapper without letting it unravel.
steps.description: Get the thin ribbon and tie it around the cupcake to hold it together.

steps.headline: Repeat for several different cupcakes.
steps.description: Sit them all neatly in the container. Once done, you can tie a nice ribbon around it to make it look beautiful!

steps.headline: Use most anything you want here, blankets, towels, diapers, clothes, baby oil, shampoo (depending on the size you want).
steps.description: This article is going to be using diapers and baby shampoo as  an example. Get a large roll of ribbon, of a particular color, and a lot of what you're using. #* Get a tall, skinny bottle, depending on what you're using. Get a wash rag or a very small piece of fabric. Get a "Cake Topper" like flowers. Get some tape. Get a stuffed animal to stand alongside your cake, as well. A teddy bear is good. Get a platter to "serve" your cake on.

steps.headline: Roll up a bunch of diapers tightly and tape the end to where it stays.
steps.description: Layer it three times around the base of the bottle. This makes the base of your cake.

steps.headline: Tie a ribbon around the base of the cake.
Sit the base of the cake on the platter.
Wrap the cloth around the bottle over the base.
Repeat the tying process, but only layer the ribbon two times around the bottle.
Tie a ribbon around it to hold it together.
steps.description: You can also replace a few of the diapers with baby shampoo. Try to make your  ribbon the same color as the baby shampoo to make it look nice.

steps.headline: Sit the base of the cake on the platter again, but only with one layer.
steps.description: You should be at or near the top of the bottle you're using. You do not need to use shampoo on this layer.

steps.headline: Tie another ribbon around it to hold it together.
steps.description: You can add some confetti or decals to the last layer to add flair.

steps.headline: Add a "cake topper" to the bottle cap.
steps.description: That makes it really look like a cake! Then, you can sit your stuffed animal friend alongside your new baby shower cake!

text: Cloth Cupcakes Pick out the thing you wish to work with. Infant clothes, diapers, or anything like that works. Blankets and towels may be too big for cupcakes. Get some cupcake wrappers (get them themed, dinosaurs, butterflies, etc.) Also, pick out a thin ribbon to tie it together when finished. Get a tiny sock (only one). This works better when making an even number of cupcakes. You can also get a clear box, like a donut box, to put all of the cupcakes in when finished.This article is going to be referring to a baby onesie . Get your onesie and fold it like you would fold paper (folding hot-dog wise). Do this until the onesie is thin. Fold the baby sock in half and place it at the very end of the onesie strip.  Start loosely rolling the strip, starting at the end where the sock is. Make sure the sock stays visible. Once you're done rolling, it should start to look like a cupcake! Tape the loose end to the cupcake to prevent it from coming off. Gently sit the cupcake in the wrapper without letting it unravel. Get the thin ribbon and tie it around the cupcake to hold it together. Repeat for several different cupcakes. Sit them all neatly in the container. Once done, you can tie a nice ribbon around it to make it look beautiful! Cloth Cakes Use most anything you want here, blankets, towels, diapers, clothes, baby oil, shampoo (depending on the size you want). This article is going to be using diapers and baby shampoo as  an example. Get a large roll of ribbon, of a particular color, and a lot of what you're using. #* Get a tall, skinny bottle, depending on what you're using. Get a wash rag or a very small piece of fabric. Get a "Cake Topper" like flowers. Get some tape. Get a stuffed animal to stand alongside your cake, as well. A teddy bear is good. Get a platter to "serve" your cake on. Roll up a bunch of diapers tightly and tape the end to where it stays. Layer it three times around the base of the bottle. This makes the base of your cake. Tie a ribbon around the base of the cake.  Sit the base of the cake on the platter.  Wrap the cloth around the bottle over the base.  Repeat the tying process, but only layer the ribbon two times around the bottle.  Tie a ribbon around it to hold it together. You can also replace a few of the diapers with baby shampoo. Try to make your  ribbon the same color as the baby shampoo to make it look nice. Sit the base of the cake on the platter again, but only with one layer. You should be at or near the top of the bottle you're using. You do not need to use shampoo on this layer. Tie another ribbon around it to hold it together. You can add some confetti or decals to the last layer to add flair. Add a "cake topper" to the bottle cap. That makes it really look like a cake! Then, you can sit your stuffed animal friend alongside your new baby shower cake! Finished.
